content.title: Continuous spectrum light source
content.description: A light source with a uniform continuous spectrum decretized with a given constant step. Only works when "Simulate Colors" is on.
points: Determines the direction of the rays

content.title: Circular light source
content.description: A circle with uniform 180-degree point sources places along its circumference.

content.title: Chaff
content.description: A chaff of a rectangular shape consisting of random pieces of mirrors. Modularized version of this Gallery example.
points: The top-left corner of the chaff
The bottom-right corner of the chaff

params.N: The number of mirrors in the chaff

content.title: Beam Expander
content.description: The combination of two ideal lenses with the sum of their focal lengths equals their separation distance. They expand or reduce the diameter of a beam of collimated light. Modularized version of this Gallery example.
points: The center of the first lens
The second point of the second lens
Determines the common focal point of the lenses

content.title: Ray Relay
content.description: A series of ideal identical lenses with focal length \(f\) and distance \(d\) between the lenses. A non-divergent ray trajectory is guaranteed if and only if \(d\leq 4f\). Modularized version of this Gallery example.
points: The first endpoint of the first lens
The second endpoint of the first lens (should have the same \(x\) as the first point)

params.f: The focal length of the lenses

content.title: Optical Fiber
content.description: Line-shaped optical fiber with given core and cladding thickness and refractive indices.
points: The first endpoint of the optical fiber
The second endpoint of the optical fiber (should have the same \(y\) as the first point)

params.n_1: The refractive index of the core
params.n_2: The refractive index of the cladding
